modules.description: This module provides formatters for inspecting OCaml values with minimal configuration, using sensible defaults and OCaml-like syntax. It supports standard data types like lists, arrays, options, results, and records, with utilities to format fields and structured values. Concrete use cases include debugging output, logging structured data, and displaying complex nested values in a readable format.

This module provides combinators for constructing formatters that handle layout control (indentation, line breaks), structural formatting (wrapping values, custom separators), and composition of values into human-readable outputs. It operates on `Format.formatter` and `'a Fmt.t` types, supporting atomic values (integers, floats, strings) and structured data (records, lists, results) with customizable styling, padding, and error messaging. Common use cases include generating debug logs, pretty-printed representations of complex data, and user-facing output that adapts to terminal capabilities like UTF-8 or ANSI color codes.

This module configures formatters for terminal output with optional style rendering and UTF-8 encoding. It works with output channels and formatter objects to enable colored or styled text in terminal interfaces. Concrete use cases include enhancing command-line tools with colored logs or structured terminal output.
